Key Match Events: The Phoenix Suns clawed back from a 15-point deficit to edge the Miami Heat 115-112.
Kevin Durant's clutch jumper from the free-throw line with just 16 seconds left sealed a four-point cushion for Phoenix.
Tyler Herro stood out for the Heat (3-4), scoring 28 points and keeping Miami competitive throughout the game.
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat had one last opportunity to tie the game in the final seconds. Down by three with four seconds remaining, Miami's attempt to set up a potential game-tying shot fizzled when Butler, after faking a shot, passed the ball to Herro, who was positioned out of bounds.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns picked up their sixth-straight win over the Miami Heat Wednesday.
This latest defeat adds to Miami's early-season struggles as they continue to search for consistency.
The Heat had a solid defense, among the best in the east, taking into account OPP PPG.
Others: Kevin Durant led the Suns with 32 points, while Jusuf Nurkic turned in a commanding performance with 20 points and 18 rebounds.
Bam Adebayo struggled with efficiency, going just 5-for-21 from the field, though he did record a double-double with 12 points and 12 rebounds to go with 6 assists and 5 steals.
